Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks for all your responses . I’m sorry to hear about your experiences having to go through this - you are all strong ladies .  I see most of you opted for the auxiliary nodes clearance . Can you give me bit more information regarding how long stayed in hospital, was it much painful op compared to previous one involving removal of Sentinel nodes, I note that a drain will need to be fitted in place for few days and then removed.  I’m just worried about complications , risk if lymphodema, I caught infection when my sentinel nodes were removed which ballooned up to size of a tennis ball however now a week later has shrunk to size of an egg and improving. It’s getting better . I understand that they won’t proceed with the auxiliary nodes clearance op until I am fully healed so we’re looking at another month before consider operating.  I think I will need to discuss this op in detail with the surgeon next week as I didn’t have much confidence in breast doctor who saw me as she disheveled know my case or background although the BC sister who was present was very helpful.  The posnoc trials - I was reading up on the literature the BC nurse gave me and it says that it’s a randomized trial of armpit treatment for those with early breast cancer  They say that they do not know if treatment to the armpit adds any further benefit to adjuvant therapy thus reason why they are doing this study . Question is whether I will be chosen to take part and knowing what their decision  would be ie I would benefit or not .  I think I may have to just go with the safe option and op for further surgery .
Posts.Title: Results following BC op

Posts.Content: Hi  We discussed the operation and she said that she would be looking to remove all the lymph nodes - all levels . It’s all or nothing.  It would involve another procedure and she confirmed risk of lymphodema was circa 30%.  You were very lucky to have negotiated with your surgeon not to clear out all your nodes as the risk increases as more nodes are removed  They would be looking to operate within the next 31 days however I don’t know if I’m up to having another operation so soon after my original . I’m still recovering from the first as I developed a haematona and it’s only started to subside ( it’s now been 3 weeks) along with the pain and suffering  If u go for the op then that will be another 3-4 weeks pain . She also discussed about false nodes readings at the time of biopsy estimated at 7% so there is no guarantees that the nodes are if confirmed as being clear are in fact clear  I got  the impression that they were pushing me into giving auxilia radiotherapy serious thought as this would spare me a lot of pain and suffering plus the fact that I wouldn’t have to go through unnecessary operation when the survival rates of having just radiotherapy is more  or less the same .  She mentioned that in the past it was standard practice to perform one operation and remove the tunour plus remove all lymph glands however over the years with past studies felt it was no longer necessary to give  patients all treatments available .  My concern is the risk of cancer cells spreading to other parts of the body if they have spread to other lymph glands however the breast nurse confirmed that even if The glands are removed   the risk of cancer cells soreading still exists  I am finding this a very difficult decision to make as I feel they are pushing me towards radiotherapy whereas a lot of people have opted  for ANC  My surgeon has said that she would support whichever decision I make -  my call at the end of day .. no rush .. just need to give it proper thought   Xx

Posts.Title: Results following BC op

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed last month with Stage 1 (Grade 1 invasive ductal/ tubular  Breast Cancer and had surgery 3 weeks ago.  I saw a BC Doctor this afternoon  ( not my normal one who did the op) who confirmed that I had  1cm tumour & 2 Sentinel Nodes removed, clear margins and one of the nodes was clear  however the other was not.   ER weakly positive. ( they confirmed it was only 33% dependent ) HER2 was negative. Very upset that the results for my nodes came back positive and we discussed options which was me either having auxiliary nodes removed.  ( level 2) to check to see whether these nodes are infected too or to partake in one of their clinical trials and see what treatment options are available for me as radiotherapy on lymph nodes may be an option. But then again they could come back stating they can not offer me any treatments.  I have a lot of thinking to do however not sure what to do for the best .  If I undergo radiotherapy there is no guarantees that the cancer cells will be destroyed and whether they will return or spread further. No guarantees whether this will work for me or whether surgery is the answer  Has anybody been through the same and opted for their auxiliary nodes to be removed ?  I have until next Thursday to think about my next steps and discuss this through with my surgeon / oncologist.  There was no mention of  Oncotype DX test & would I have had it done - something I will have to speak to my BC surgeon / oncologist about next Thursday  Is it worth me having a second opinion from another oncologist from another hospital as I didn’t have much confidence in the BC doctor who gave my results   Feeling so low
Posts.Title: Results following BC op

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies for your kind words.  Leolady and Carolyn.  It’s a lot to take in. I don’t think they are explaining it well to me unless I am not asking the right questions . Seeing different breast doctors etc isn’t helping either as all it’s doing is creating more doubt and uncertainty.  They’ve not really helped me deciding what is best for me rather than say it’s your decision which route to take.  Leolady - I am going to write down a list of questions for my surgeon and ask her for answers/ explanations when I see her on Thursday. I think they owe me some sort of explanation.  If I don’t get satisfactory responses I will ask for a referral/ second opinion . My life in is their hands and I hope that they are truely acting in my best interests.  With regards to counseling , I had a few counseling sessions back in Feb/March following death of my father . My father also had cancer but died from another cause/ complication so cancer does run in our family ( genetic)  Obviously my diagnosis is another blow - It sounds that I need further emotional support and counseling and it’s very raw discussing this with family members . I will look into this  My head is all over the place and I’m not thinking clearly Thanks to you both xx

Posts.Content: Hello Dizzy17 They want to operate within the next 31 days however I am in a dilemma as I booked a holiday to take mid July for 2 weeks  to Europe before I was diagnosed earlier March time  The surgeon has suggested that I cancel the holiday as I won’t be able to travel/ fly  post op due to DVT / blood clots or any other complications which is understandable so if I had the op before mid July I definitely would not be able to travel.  I explained to surgeon that I really wanted to go and not miss out as this is my only opportunity taking a holiday this year and said she would postpone the op until after I return ( end July) however it would be at my own risk  I am not sure know whether wanting to get away is the right thing and whether it makes sense like she said to cancel the holiday and just  concentrate on my health - not sure what she means by her saying it’s at your own risk ?? Ie that the cancer could spread further ( although SNB showed there being cancer cells in one node only )  and would be better operating as soon as possible ( we are only talking about an additional 2 weeks here and not months down the line or does she means that im still recovering from recent op had mid May however recovery period would have been 2 months before I depart  Some of my friends / family have said go on holiday break will do you good while some friends were concerned about my health and said cancel the holiday / have the op/ go on holiday after when all treatments have been completed however this will be many months down the line  Any thoughts ?
Posts.Title: Results following BC op

Posts.Content: Hi everybody  I have been giving ANC more thought , this is all I have been thinking about and really stressing me out whether I should or should not proceed and whether I will be fortunate not to develop any complications such as lymodema  I am really annoyed why there wasn’t a pathologist present during surgery who could have analyzed the sentinel nodes once removed and confirmed at the time whether there was any signs of micro or macromatises.  They confirmed 2 weeks later  one of the nodes they removed was showing signs of macromatises not greater than 2 mm thus reason why they feel that having ANC will not necessarily be of any benefit  so I understand why they want to use me as a guinea pig for their trials whether ANC would be warranted.  Had a pathologist been present at the time and detected signs of matises then the surgeon could have proceeded to remove few more during the op and check to see if these were clear etc .  I wish my surgeon had explained to me prior to the operation that this would not be done for me so I could have gone to another hospital to have the procedure done where pathologist carries out the checks .  All this has done is cause more pain and anguish for me with the thought of having to undergo another operation which they could have spared if they had done it correctly in the first place.  I’m really furious and cannot console myself -  feeling very sad  especially as I’m still feeling raw following the death of my father earlier this year - my cancer diagnosis has just been another blow for me which totally unexpected.
Posts.Title: Results following BC op

Posts.Content: Good evening to you all  Good news - I managed to see my surgeon this afternoon as a patient had cancelled their appt  We had further discussions in relation to auxiliary node clearance versus auxilia radiotherapy  http://www.breastcancer.org/research-news/20130712-2 From Breastcancer.org: More Research Shows That Axillary Lymph Node Removal May Not Make Sense for Many Women My surgeon feels that the benefits of having radiotherapy is more or less the same compared to removing all lymph nodes and survival rate for both is more or less the same   The risk of contracting lymphodema is lower having underarm radiotherapy compared to ANC  I would be interested to hear your views as I am still undecided whether to go for the clearance or opt for auxiliary radiotherapy  We again discussed the clinical trials however a computer would decide ( should I opt this route) whether I would receive ANC or auxilia radiotherapy  Not sure whether I would want a computer to decide route to take  Regards
Posts.Title: Results following BC op

Posts.Content: Just an update  After a lot of thought , following my appt with the surgeon I was chased by her PA this week as they wanted to know whether I had reached  a decision how I wanted to  proceed - whether I wanted surgery to remove AXilla nodes or leave them in and have underarm radiotherapy along with the breast area or partake in posnoc trial  I came to the conclusion that surgery was best for me and I am now on the waiting list .  Decision not made lightly : I have anguished over this for a week knowing what was best option for me and feeling very sad that I have to go through this  journey alone .  I feel as if my life has been put on hold , I cannot relax, sleep at night , feeling very low  I spoke too my employers who confirmed they are supporting me and checking with occupational health in what other ways they can support me ie counselling etc  My life has changed ever since being diagnosed and I feel as if I have aged 10 years ..  Because my arm is still sore , it prevents me from doing anything such as exercise or work as I’ve lost interest in what is going on around me  I just wish I can snap out of this depression I’m in and get on with life however I feel that I will struggle to move forward with all this hanging over my head  I just hope the surgery is successful and don’t get any complications such as  lymphodema

Posts.Content: Hi Purplemarriane, yes it’s definitelty a haematona as I did go to see a Breast care nurse - she originally thought it was a seroma, tried to drain it but only blood came out . Examined by a doctor and he confirmed it was haematona.  I was in excruciating pain for over 2 hours before they gave me oral morphine followed by IV fluids . They have given me ibrophen and penicillin to clear the infection . They told me to apply ice however compared to the size it had ballooned to on Friday , it seems to have reduced now but very sore esoectially when my arm touches it . The nurses have given me pressure pads to apply to it however I am reluctant to do any arm exercises as I’m worried that this may have been cause : may have over did it or lifted something heavy .  I will never know , it is so irritable I cannot sleep at night . Luckily I was signed off work for 4 weeks so I’ve got another 2 weeks to recover before go back to work . I really pray it will go away on its own before 2 months as due to go away on holiday  .. last thing I need is a big lump showing and irritating me .. nor do I want any surgical intervention to remove the clot Thanks for the hugs xx

Posts.Content: Hi Catlover it has been a while since I last posted. I was faced with a similar dilemma as you whereby I had to choose between ANC , Rads or Posnoc trial  I was sick to my stomach as felt pressurized by the Hospitsl which route I wanted to take as they could not advise . My dureonbwebt through all the options and I felt that they would have liked me to go via the trial . As my cancer is a slow growing one , grade one and they only found one infected Node following SNB , they were more slongbthe lines that there was a possibility that my other nodes would not be affected and at one stage felt either the Rads or Trial route would be the most appropriate. With regards to the clearance , I still have some BCN stipulate that having the ANC is giving more treatment than is required as if I had gone down the rads route they felt that my survival rate would be similar to had I gone down the surgery route.  With regards to Rick of lymphodema, they quoted me a 30% chance if had ANC whereas if I had rads the risk would be slightly less .  I decided to opt for the ANC and my operation date set for next  Thursday.  I chose surgery for piece of mind to get rid of any surprises should other nodes be infected .  I didn’t want a computer deciding what treatment I needed going via posnoc and declined rads as firstly no guarantees will destroy all cancer cells plus there is risk of damages to healthy cells and secondly no ladies had come forward to confirm that they had opted to go for Rads rather than ANC .. i am nervous of forthcoming operation , everybody I have spoken to said I would be ok - not to worry about it . fingers crossed , everything will be fine .  Ill update after my surgery x
Posts.Title: Ancillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Good morning Cham  I feel your pain and I am also feeling very low at the moment following my surgery for lumpectomy and SNB.  Me too am waiting on an ANC and I am on the hospital waiting list which I presume will have this op towards the end of next month.  Unfortunately I cannot give you any reassurance other than I have spoken to other women who have been through this and they have successfully recovered from ANC.  For me I know I should  feel better once i get over this hurdle knowing that there is a lesser risk of cancer spreading which imagine will be the same for you. Obviously it doesn’t stop there as further treatments are in the pipeline which will need to be discussed with the oncologist. We will cross that bridge when we come to it.  The problem I’m facing is being in limbo until my next treatment- I’m trying to enjoy life but all I seem to do is worry as I feel my life has changed as I am now a cancer patient opposed to before diagnosis where I was none the wiser. I feel I can no longer get on with my previous life before diagnosis as all I think about is cancer , getting rid of this awful disease. For me time has stopped and I m desperate to get over and done with the treatments so I can move forward.  Sounds that we both need a lot of support . Have you considered counselling sessions ?  I have been referred by my GP for one to one sessions and find that talking does help.  You are also in the right place here as this community is an excellent site to share any worries or anxieties you may have etc as we are all in the same boat.  Try and be optimistic- I know it’s hard - we can beat this !  Sending you some hugs xx

Posts.Title: Aux Nodes clearance

Posts.Content: Good evening ladies  I am now Day 4 post operative and making progress with my recovery . My arm is very sore and painful at times . The incision gets very sore especially that I cannot wash or apply any pressure to the wound . I still have a drain fitted however this can now be removed as fluid is now circa 20 msl in 24 hour period . It’s been like this for 2 days and I’m still awaiting for my district nurse to make contact !  Imfact I am so very annoyed with the whole situation following discharge . The discharge nurse supposedly faxed referral form for visits to the community nursing team and I have had to constantly chase both the nursing team plus the hospital ward that discharged me.  They nursing team confirmed 2 days ago they had not received a referral form so I phoned the Hospital only to learn that they faxed the form to an incorrect fax number so they never received it .  I phoned the Hospital again yesterday as I still had no contact from the district nurse and they said I was on their urgent priority list - again no contact from nurse .  I phoned again this morning and again could not get through to community nurse office so I phoned the hospital again and they said the same thing , the nurse would be out sometime today . It if now 10.20 pm and still no contact or visit from them which means I need to spend another night with a drain fitted which could have been removed 2 days ago.  I know how busy they are but the way my aftercare has been handled has been appauling .. this leaves me with no option to call the hospital again tomoro and ask I come in so they can assess my wound and remove the drain . If they are unable then the  BC clinic or my GP will need to get this sorted  Not a happy bunny - can’t believe I am having to go through all of this on top off breast cancer diagnosis..  i expect the best from the NHS however they seem to be letting themselves down with patient care.  :(
